report_title: Exploration and Production Companies Likely to Respond to Recovering Energy Prices
executive_summary:
The Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry produces equipment used to measure various gases, including oxygen, carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxide. The industry is highly competitive, heavily concentrated and led by MSA Safety Inc., the global leader in industry device production. Industry growth is largely determined by the health of downstream markets, including mining and manufacturing sectors. These industries use gas detectors to monitor systems and environments to alert workers of hazardous conditions.

Over the five years to 2020, gradually improving energy prices encouraged energy producers to invest in exploration and production projects, supporting industry growth. However, as macroeconomic conditions deteriorated alongside the emergence of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, demand for industry products retracted. IBISWorld expects industry revenue to decline an annualized 2.6% to $289.9 million during the period, including a fall of 17.8% in 2020 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Operators produce handheld and fixed gas detectors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators in the Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry produce handheld and fixed gas detectors, which are used to detect and monitor the presence of gas within a particular area. These instruments can gauge the presence or absence of one or many gases, including oxygen, carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, and nitrogen oxide.

Gas detection device manufacturers depend heavily on demand from downstream markets, such as the oil and gas, manufacturing and mining sectors. Operators in these markets use gas detection devices in various applications. Demand from these downstream clients depends on various volatile factors determined on a global scale.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Devices detect oxygen deficiency or combustible gases
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Devices used for the detection of an oxygen deficiency or the presence of combustible or toxic gases is anticipated to comprise 33.7% of industry revenue in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue decline due to COVID-19 pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As macroeconomic conditions deteriorated alongside the emergence of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, demand for industry products retracted. IBISWorld expects industry revenue to decline 17.8% in 2020 alone. Over the five years to 2020, revenue is estimated to fall at an annualized rate of 2.6% to $289.9 million.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue growth expected due to rebounding demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry is expected to benefit from rebounding downstream demand over the five years to 2025, leading to revenue growth across the highly competitive industry. As global energy prices rebound, demand for gas detection devices from downstream companies in the oil, gas and mining sectors will likely rise.

Industry manufacturers are heavily dependent on demand from downstream industries, including those in the mining and manufacturing sectors. Over the next five years, demand from the industry's largest downstream markets is projected to grow as they resume greater levels of production.

International trade is projected to remain a crucial component to the health of the domestic industry. Strong competition from international manufacturers able to take advantage of lower costs will likely continue to undercut industry growth. However, a depreciating US dollar is expected to support industry exports.

The implementation of more stringent domestic regulations mandating enhanced safety procedures, especially in oil and gas drilling, will likely generate additional demand for the industry. This will result in new and improved products from gas detection manufacturers to help meet rising regulatory requirements.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Exports of goods produced by the Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry are estimated to account for 47.9% of revenue in 2020.

The oil and gas sector is expected to account for 26.4% of industry revenue in 2020. As this sector constantly works with combustible and potential toxic gases, gas detection devices are required at nearly all oil and gas worksites.

Gas detectors are employed throughout the manufacturing sector, largely for the purpose of monitoring toxic gases and for detecting the presence of flames. The manufacturing sector is projected to account for 10.3% of industry revenue in 2020.

Similar to the oil and gas sector, mining companies depend on industry products to screen for combustible and toxic gases that could compromise worker safety. Demand from mining is largely determined by demand for mineral commodities, including coal, iron ore and bauxite. In 2020, IBISWorld expects the mining sector to account for 8.8% of industry revenue.

Other downstream markets for industry products include the utilities sector and government agencies. These segments share of downstream demand has marginally increased during the current period, accounting for an estimated 6.6% of industry revenue in 2020.

products_and_services.product_description: Portable gas detectors are handheld devices that are used for the detection of an oxygen deficiency in confined spaces or the presence of combustible or toxic gases.

Fixed gas detectors are devices that continuously monitor the air for the presence of combustible, toxic or asphyxiating gases in industrial settings such as chemical plants, oil and gas refineries, pipelines and ventilation ducts.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Factors that affect demand for industry products from the mining and energy industries include production of oil and gas in response to worldwide demand, changing production profiles of existing fields, discovery of new oil and gas fields, quality of new hydrocarbon production and oil and gas producers' investments in exploration and production (E&P).

Demand for industry products is also driven by the health of the domestic manufacturing sector. The Industrial Production Index, which measures the output from the mining, manufacturing, electric and gas industries, has marginally grown over the past five years.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Since conventional industry products can be manufactured in countries with lower labor, operating and compliance costs, imported gas detection devices have remained integral to many downstream industries.
Over the five years to 2020, IBISWorld anticipates the value of industry exports to decline at an annualized rate of 3.9% to $138.7 million.

concentration_points.concentration_description: In 2020, the industry's top four companies are estimated to account for a combined 85.3% of revenue.
Industry concentration has grown slightly over the five years to 2020 mainly through mergers and acquisitions.
The industry is dominated by only a few large multinational corporations which manufacture and supply many types of sophisticated safety products.
Due to the niche nature of industry products, there are a limited number of industry players.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Research and development (R&D) expenses represent 12.3% of other expenses in 2020. Given the industry's competitive nature and strong dependence on product innovation, R&D is vital in keeping up with technological advances.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry has a low level of capital intensity. For every $1.00 spent on labor, IBISWorld estimates the average industry operator to invest $0.08 on capital in 2020.
Although the industry requires a significant amount of capital investment, industry employees are required for a range of manufacturing and administrative functions.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry has a moderate level of volatility. Over the five years to 2020, industry revenue is expected to grow as much as 13.1% in 2018 and fall as much as 17.8% in 2020.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Gas Detection Device Manufacturing industry is at the forefront of technological advancement, investing significantly in research and development to improve products to meet customer needs.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports compete with domestic devices on a cost basis due to lower-wage costs abroad. Consequently, companies invest in research and development to differentiate their products.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies specialize in a niche to better serve specific customers. For example, manufacturers produce specialized gas detection devices for firefighters to better serve their needs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices for metals such as steel have fluctuated historically, with large increases in recent years.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Outsourcing manufacturing to low-cost regions greatly reduces wage costs. Consequently, manufacturers have turned to low-wage labor to remain competitive on price.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: Automation has greatly enhanced manufacturing capacity and standardization of products. New energy-efficient equipment is being used to save on costs and create more efficient goods.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to curb wage costs for manufacturing employees. However, companies hire highly-specialized employees that require high levels of compensation.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Working with industry associations keeps companies aware of the latest trends across the industry. Additionally, investment in new manufacturing equipment helps companies comply with more stringent regulation.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies implement standard operating procedures that must be followed throughout the manufacturing process. Additionally, companies conduct training sessions and offer courses to enhance workers' understanding of the processes and how they relate to their safety.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Volatile input prices have constrained profit margins. Consequently, due to the volatile nature of inputs, it has been difficult to adjust prices accurately.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Due to product specialization, many customers renew their contracts. Additionally, specifically tailored products help to keep customers satisfied and renew their contracts.

FAQs.question: Does your establishment have access to, or contracts with, reliable manufacturers? How many suppliers does your company have?
FAQs.answer: Access to a consistent supply of competitively priced raw material inputs is essential to remaining competitive.

FAQs.question: Are your operations running at capacity? Are there any ways you could better use your resources?
FAQs.answer: The ability to use existing capacity to its optimum efficiency is essential.

FAQs.question: Are you able to leverage economies of scale? What is your budget for expanding operations?
FAQs.answer: Low-cost, streamlined manufacturing facilities operating on a large scale are essential in this competitive industry.

FAQs.question: How have fluctuations in the value of the US dollar affected demand for your products? Has import penetration affected your revenue?
FAQs.answer: When the value of the US dollar is high, imports become less costly and import volumes increase, creating a more price-competitive atmosphere. A strong dollar also depresses industry exports. Thus, an increase in the trade-weighted index will typically hamper industry revenue.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your revenue is tied to demand from this sector? How have shifts in this sector influenced demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Industry products are essential to oil and gas exploration. Demand from the oil and gas sectors is affected by worldwide demand for oil and the changing production profiles of existing fields, among other things.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your products are used for industrial purposes? How do you track investment in equipment and machinery?
FAQs.answer: Industry products are essential inputs in the production of industrial equipment. Consequently, private investment in industrial equipment and machinery will typically move in line with demand for industry products.
